text:
I've discovered a bug filling a shape using objectBoundingBox gradientUnits,  
with linearGradient patterns...look at   
this file ( http://www.integrasoftware.it/tmp/test.svg ) and render it with  
batik; the square should be filled entirely...  
Adobe SVG Viewer shows it very well so I think is a batik mistake.  
  
Thanks, Francesco.
creator: strapz@tiscali.it
strapz@tiscali.it
text:
Doing additional tests, I've noted that, if the rect has an y="20", the 
gradient will be painted from 40, while if the rect has an y="10", the 
gradient will be painted from 20, doubling it... 
Verify it please, thanks.

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
Batik is doing the correct thing.  I think you want to
use 'viewBox="0 0 1 1"' instead of objectBoundingBox.
It is important to realize that objectBoundingBox
maps coorindate 0,0 in the child to x,y of the 'object'.
So in your case the patternUnits already mapped 
0,0->x,y.  The reality is that the usecase for
patternContentUnits is pretty weak people almost always
want/need viewBox.
